oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Alan Rhody and Rafe Van Hoy - 2018-01-20
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by singer songwriters Alan Rhody and Rafe Van Hoy from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on January 20, 2018.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments and introduction of songwriters / 03:16) Opening comments by Alan and Rafe / (03:47) Song introduction by Alan / (04:19) Performs Wild-eyed Dream (Alan Rhody) / (07:57) Rafe intros his next song / (10:33) Performs Golden Ring (Rafe Van Hoy) / (14:05) Alan intros the next song / (15:51) Performs I'll Be True To You (Alan) / (20:31) Rafe intros the family of Curly Putman in the audience and then intros next song / (24:13) Performs I Wish I Could Hurt That Way Again (Rafe) / (27:05) Alan talks about Curly Putnam and Roger Miller / (28:01) Alan intros the next song / (30:31) Performs One Of Two Thousand (Alan) / (34:04) Rafe intros the next song / (34:42) Performs Old Flames Have New Names (Rafe) / (37:28) Alan intros the next song / (37:58) Performs Train Wreck Of Emotion (Alan) / (41:47) Alan makes CD pitch to the audience / (42:15) Rafe intros the next song / (43:18) Performs What's Forever For (Rafe) / (46:21) Final comments / (46:41) Walk-out music /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Rhody, Alan; Van Hoy, Rafe; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
